title: Add predefined label set and dropdown selection in Admin upload

requirements.text: Create a predefined label list based on the uploaded image and make it available to the frontend as a single source of truth. The label list must include: Colorart, Vintage, Hermosa, Rurban, Essentials, Eternal Treasure, Hues, Inhouse, Cotsmere, Little Maspar, Generic, Maspar.

quotes: ye labels bana do fir admine labels ke acroding colestin dal dega

acceptanceCriteria: A dedicated module (e.g., in frontend/src/lib) exports the label set as an array (or similar) that can be imported by UI components.

The exported label set includes exactly the 12 labels shown in the uploaded image: Colorart, Vintage, Hermosa, Rurban, Essentials, Eternal Treasure, Hues, Inhouse, Cotsmere, Little Maspar, Generic, Maspar.
No user-facing UI text is introduced in Hindi; user-facing UI text remains English.

requirements.text: Update the Admin Upload form so admins can select from the predefined labels instead of typing label text manually. Keep bilingual label support: selecting a predefined label should populate the English label field, and the Hindi label field must remain editable so admins can enter/override Hindi when needed.

quotes: ye labels bana do fir admine labels ke acroding colestin dal dega

acceptanceCriteria: AdminUploadForm provides a label selection control (dropdown/combobox) that lists the predefined labels.
When a predefined label is selected, the English label input is automatically set to that label value.
The Hindi label input remains present and editable after selecting a predefined label.
Existing add-item flow still works: added items persist to localStorage and appear in the Admin catalog manager and Public Viewer without regressions.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components); compose them as-is.
Do not change authentication approach (AdminGate remains the fixed credential check).
Do not add backend persistence; continue using localStorage for catalog storage.
nonGoals: Do not implement a new backend canister API for labels or catalog items.
Do not implement automatic translation from English labels to Hindi labels.
Do not change the existing collection system beyond what is necessary to let admins assign collections as they do today.
